title: Sampler, 1834
medium:
Medium: silk and human hair embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, satin, eyelet, buttonhole, half cross, knot, and running stitching on plain weave foundation
description: Two scenes and a short text within a curving floral border. Top central scene is an illustration of a scene in Laurence Sterne's book "A Sentimental Journey" showing the dejected character, Maria, as she is described in the book. The book is quoted: "God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb said Maria."  The bottom scene shows a pagoda over a bridge, a woman holding a parasol and a basket, and two owls sitting in a tree. A balloon carrying two passengers is rises over the pagoda.  The text at the top reads, "Elizabeth Tudor Aged 12 years 1834" and "Prepare to meet thy God."

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1834.
1834. Medium: silk and human hair embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, satin, eyelet, buttonhole, half cross, knot, and running stitching on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-104.
